column4: Is there any way to defrag a vfat filesystem from Ubuntu? >_> I asked a while back but.. I think nobody noticed.
i dont think there is, you may have to go into windows t do that.
why d yu have a vfat partition then, if yu dont have windows??
linux iteslf doesnt need to be defrag, so n such thing exist for linux, so i dnt think you can get a defrag tool fr any filesystem in linux. b ut i may be wrong.
